Package renderer

Class RenderThread

java.lang.Object
renderer.RenderThread
public class RenderThread
extends java.lang.Object
Renderer class is responsible for generating pixel color map from a graphic scene, using ImageWriter class

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  RenderThread.Pixel
    Pixel is an internal helper class whose objects are associated with a Render object that they are generated in scope of.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean adaptiveSS
    true if we want to use adaptive super sampling
    private Camera camera
    the information about camera & view - plane

    uses in case of exception

    accumulation of pixel color matrix, and holding image related parameters of View Plane - pixel matrix size and resolution

    printing progress percentage

    Spare threads if trying to use all the cores

  • Method Details

    • setMultithreading

      public RenderThread setMultithreading​(int threads)
      Set multi-threading
      - if the parameter is 0 - number of cores less 2 is taken
      Parameters:
      threads - number of threads
      Returns:
      the Render object itself

    • setDebugPrint

      public RenderThread setDebugPrint()
      Set debug printing on
      Returns:
      the Render object itself

      Returns:
      renderer itself - for chaining

    • writeToImage

      public void writeToImage()
      Produce a rendered image file

    • castRay

      private void castRay​(int nX, int nY, int col, int row)
      Cast ray from camera in order to color a pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - resolution on X axis (number of pixels in row)
      nY - resolution on Y axis (number of pixels in column)
      col - pixel's column number (pixel index in row)
      row - pixel's row number (pixel index in column)

    • renderImageThreaded

      private void renderImageThreaded()
      This function renders image's pixel color map from the scene included with the Renderer object - with multi-threading

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      This function renders image's pixel color map from the scene included with the Renderer object

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid​(int step, Color color)
      Create a grid [over the picture] in the pixel color map. given the grid's step and color.
      Parameters:
      step - grid's step
      color - grid's color

    • renderPixel

      private Color renderPixel​(double nX, double nY, int depth, Ray[] central)
      the render function when we use adaptive
      Parameters:
      nX - number of pixels in row
      nY - number of pixels in column
      depth - the recursive depth
      central - array of the rays, at first it contains only the central ray in the third index
      Returns:
      the color of the whole pixel

    • renderPixelRecursive

      private Color renderPixelRecursive​(Ray[] myRays, double nX, double nY, int depth)
      Function for calculating the color of a pixel by using a subdivision - squares when necessary, until stopped when we reached the maximum depth
      Parameters:
      myRays - array of rays we gonna full it (or he is already full and we just compare it to know if new colors are added)
      nX - number of pixels in row
      nY - number of pixels in column
      depth - the depth of the recursive
      Returns:
      the average color of the pixel

    • getImage

      public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
